subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Seasons
entries: From the intense passion of Summer, the withering decay of Autumn follows in its wake, soon met by the elusive respite of Winter, only for life to blossom back in Spring. And so the process repeats, over and over.
Druids of the Circle of the Seasons revere this constant cycle, calling upon the land's myriad phases to instil their magic with a similar changeability and adapt to any situation at hand.

subclassFeature.name: Call Summer, Autumn, Winter, Spring
entries: As an action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to Call the essence of one of the seasons through yourself, temporarily harnessing its power.

Calling a season grants you access to its respective spells on the Seasonal Spells table below, along with an additional druid cantrip of your choice. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
This transformation lasts for 8 hours. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), are {@condition incapacitated}, die, or use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Blessings of the Cycle
entries: You take on an additional aspect of the season you Call, granting you a special boon while transformed by it:

entries.name: Summer's Assault
entries: Whenever you deal damage with one of your spells, you can add your proficiency bonus to its results.

entries.name: Autumn's Decline
entries: Whenever a creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells, you can cause it to be {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Winter's Protection
entries: You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws, or +2 to your Constitution saving throws if you are already proficient in it.

entries.name: Spring's Resurgence
entries: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can cause a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you to gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus plus the spell's level. If it has 0 hit points, it also regains 1 hit point.

subclassFeature.name: Call Solstice, Call Equinox
entries: You can expend two uses of your Wild Shape feature to Call two seasons at once, tapping into the boundary where one transitions to the other to channel both of their strengths. The two seasons must be adjacent to each other - you can't Call Summer and Winter together, or Autumn and Spring.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Star in Four Seasons
entries: Drawing upon the seasons becomes effortless to you, letting you Call them as a bonus action. Additionally, for every use of Wild Shape you expend per Call, you can cast a 3rd-level or lower spell from your available Seasonal Spells without expending a spell slot.
